trial_identification.studytitle: Effects of a whole body dynamic exercise program on hip mobility and balance in healthy older adults
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effectiveness of a whole body dynamic exercise program versus home exercise education sheets on hip mobility, balance, and self-perceive change in healthy older adults

interventions.interventions: The intervention group will receive a 10-week, twice a week of a whole body dynamic exercise intervention program.The duration of each training session will be 60 minutes. Each class will begin on a chair with a gentle warm up sequence to move the trunk and upper extremities. This is followed by a series of fluid spinal motions which increase range of motion, and prepare the body to explore more complex movements with agility, and ease based on GYROKINESIS 'Registered Trademark' method. The exercise training will be delivered in a group format with a physiotherapist who is also a certified GYROKINESIS trainer. The mode of delivery is face to face and is in a group format. The location will be at local Community Activity Centers. An exercise log will be documented by the exercise physiotherapist.
interventions.comparator: The control group will receive home exercise education sheets at the first visit and reviewed at the midterm (6-week) visit. The exercise sheets with general stretching exercises are developed specifically for this study. Participants instructed to exercise at their own discretion. An exercise log was given to participants in the control group to improve fidelity.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Hip passive range of motion assessed by a smartphone inclinometer.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline, 6-week midterm test, and post-test after 10-week intervention.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Hip active range of motion assessed by the Chair Sit and Reach Test (CSR).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline, 6-week midterm test, and post-test after 10-week intervention.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Balance ability assessed by the Brief Balance Evaluation Systems Test (Brief-BESTest).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline, 6-week midterm test, and post-test after 10-week intervention.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: perceive change assessed by the Lower Extremity Functional Scale (LEFS)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline, 6-week midterm test, and post-test after 10-week intervention.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: perceive change assessed by the Global Rating of Change (GROC).
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline, 6-week midterm test, and post-test after 10-week intervention.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 1. Aged >=60 years 2. Healthy participants whi can ambulate independently 3. Able to follow instructions
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: 1. Need to use any assistive walking device to ambulate 2. History of previous hip fracture or hip surgery leading to obvious restriction of hip mobility 3. Medical or pharmacological contraindications to exercise 4. Severe physical dysfunctions 5. Moderate intellectual impairment indicated by the Short Portable Mental State Questionnaire (SPMSQ)
